abstract: United States trade representative Michael Froman and his former Harvard Law School colleague Lori Wallach, who leads Public Citizen's Global Trade Watch, are on opposite sides of debate over Trans-Pacific Partnership trade deal; Wallach is one of primary critics of deal, and has been architect of much of opposition to it, just as Froman has been vocal advocate for deal's importance.
lead_paragraph: Michael Froman, the United States trade representative championing the pact, keeps running into a familiar nemesis, the anti-globalization leader Lori Wallach.

headline.main: Trans-Pacific Partnership Puts Harvard Law School Rivals on Opposite Sides, Again
headline.print_headline: Two From Harvard in Sharp Opposition on Trade Deal

snippet: Michael Froman, the United States trade representative championing the pact, keeps running into a familiar nemesis, the anti-globalization leader Lori Wallach.
